Motor or push.
Mine is attached, a CRF230F. [img]http://moparisthebest.org/smf/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=337304.0;attach=15398[/img]

item.title: Post your bike
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:41, topic:255262”]My dad has this:


1983 Kawasaki (K)Z750 - N2 Spectre

Very rare to find in mint condition, it was only made for a year.

It is the only spectre that has NO chrome on it.[/quote]

Why would you want no chrome? Chrome is my favorite color!

Read full topic

item.title: Post your bike
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Oooh, is it illegally unrestricted? That is not good at all, if the dude really wanted to make your day bad he could ask for a copy of your certificate that the garage puts on it after they fit the restrictors. Obviously this isn’t much good if its dated after the date of the accident. Fitting them yourself might work, but you won’t have a certificate in that case either. It’s possible that if he really tried hard he could get it seized and dynod to check the maximum power output.

I wouldn’t worry too much though, if you’re not claiming off anyone I very much doubt anyone will care enough to check. Dyno’ing bikes is too expensive for some puny claim (what the hell is the other dude claiming for anyway? Damage to his bicycle?) At least in the UK, you only have to worry when riding a powerful bike on a 33bhp probation (oops)

disclaimer, im not a lawyer, just had the experience and i dont even live in your country, so things could be different etc

EDIT: oh and thats the other thing - he got your details but didnt give you his? shouldn’t have allowed that to happen, but shit happens

EDIT2: what kind of ped is that btw? can’t see clearly from the pics, looks a bit like a gilera dna50 tho?

Read full topic

item.title: Post your bike
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If it wasn’t your fault the other person should pay for all the damages, unless the insurance totals it out. How much was the bike worth before the accident?

Read full topic

item.title: Post your bike
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Waffendennis:

I’ll see if I can find some pics of my old R6 from 2004 and the R1 from 2002 which was totalled last year :(!

waffendennis is a dirty squid

jk, shame about the r1, it do you any damage?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 08, 2009, 02:14:01 am[/size][hr][quote=“Greeny, post:20, topic:255262”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=337304.msg2619325#msg2619325 date=1231272140]
Not got a pic of my current bike atm, so I’ll stick someone elses pic of the same model in here for the moment and take one later

Honda superdream, 400cc twin.
[/quote]

What’s insurance like? DO WANT.[/quote]

Insurance is pretty good actually, forget this years quote but I can dig it out for ya if you really want. 4 years no claims bonus + not being 17 helps, I seem to remember it was pretty shit when I insured it the first year

Not the sportiest bike in the world but it’s good on fuel and surprisingly good fun in the twisties for a small bike… and I’m a big fan of the streetfightery bare engine look anyway so I don’t mind its lack of crotchrocket ness too much

Read full topic
